intro: Jaltomata nigricolor, commonly known as the black-flowered groundcherry, is a species native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color, often with a slight waxy coating. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture and can have a mild, aromatic scent. Jaltomata nigricolor is often found in open woods and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
